alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Dolores, or 43 miles southeast of Monticello, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dolores, Lebanon, Yellow Jacket and Lewis. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 33 and 45. Colorado 145 between mile markers 3 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
